page.title: 14Farming in Inchnadamph.
page.content: {Kirkton Farm}is owned by Mr.P.Wilson of Perthshire. The manager and his family live at Kirkton farmhouse. The arable land at Inchnadamph is not cropped due to remoteness and high costs. Even hay is brought in.{1,300 {cheviot ewes}are kept and graze at will over{1,236 hectares.45 tups(rams) are kept for breeding. Ewes are en- closed infield at the main steading at {Achmore}for lambing during{April and {May. 90% lambs}are expected from{800 {ewes,1 in 10 sheep having twins.Shear- {ing}takes place in{June and July, doz- {ing (inoculation against disease) and {dipping are twice yearly.}Other shep- herds and keepers assist as no help is kept.Sheep are marked by a hole in the left ear and a red keel on the right rib.{55 cattle (Charolais,Hereford and {Highland crosses)}come for summer grazing and qualify for{hill subsidy.
